meanings.definition: A line of verse consisting of two metrical feet.
meanings.sent1: The poem had a dimeter that made it short and sweet.
meanings.sent2: In the dimeter, each line had only two metrical feet.
meanings.sent3: The dimeter in the poem was like a tiny dance of words.
meanings.sent4: Her dimeter of thoughts skipped lightly across the page.
meanings.sent5: The dimeter added a rhythmic beat to the poem.

meanings.definition: A metrical foot consisting of two syllables.
meanings.sent1: The dimeter in the verse created a simple rhythm.
meanings.sent2: Each dimeter in the poem had two syllables that flowed smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The dimeter of the song was like a gentle tap on the shoulder.
meanings.sent4: His dimeter of speech echoed through the room.
meanings.sent5: The dimeter added a musical quality to the writing.
